title: Winners of the Sustainable Beauty Awards 2023 unveiled in Paris - Premium beauty
summary: The Sustainable Beauty Awards 2023 recognized companies for their sustainable products, packaging, and initiatives. Weleda won the New Sustainable Product Award for its Skin Food Facial Cleansing Balm, while New Zealand's Organic Bioactives won the Sustainable Ingredient Award for its OceanDerMX Lift & Firm Freeze Dried, Preservative Free. DTS Europe won the Sustainable Packaging Award for its Pacific pump, and AAK Personal Care and Weleda were joint winners of the Sustainability Pioneer Award. O'right was the winner of the Sustainability Leadership Award.

title: Braskem launches first EVA grades with recycled raw material for footwear and sporting goods markets in Brazil - Braskem
summary: Braskem, a petrochemical company in Brazil, has launched two new grades of EVA plastic for the footwear and sports equipment industries made from recycled materials. These products are the first such products in the Brazilian market and are part of Braskem's larger circularity ecosystem. Using recycled raw material makes these products greener than traditional products in these sectors and reduces the amount of plastic waste entering landfills or the environment.

title: IBU Season 2023/2024 set for new rules and higher sustainability standards - International Biathlon Union
summary: The International Biathlon Union (IBU) is implementing several new rules and sustainability initiatives for the 2023/2024 season, including a full ban on fluorinated skis to reduce environmental and health concerns. Nine World Cup Organizing Committees have signed the IBU's Sustainability Charter, committing to six commitments with concrete actions to help focus and fast-track efforts to reduce environmental impact while enhancing social legacies. The season will be held across 10 venues with the season finishing in North America in March.
